text.p: These are the highlights of the main Sao Paulo and Rio de Janeiro newspapers this morning.
-- WHY BRAZIL IS LOSING MARKET IN THE U.S.

Brazil, the second biggest exporter of shoes to the U.S., is losing market. Brazilian shoes exports to the U.S. have been falling since 1993. The government blames U.S. import tariffs, but the problem is Brazil's difficulties to compete with other countries, China in particular.
-- CULTURAL UNION IS MERCOSUR'S NEW TARGET
The cultural union between Brazil, Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay is now a priority of the Mercosur's agenda.
-- BBA TO BUY BCN WITHOUT OLACYR

Brazil's Banco BBA Creditanstalt will buy the control of local bank BCN without Grupo Itamarati's owner Olacyr de Moraes as a minority shareholder. In July, BCN and Banco Itamarati announced a merger. But now BCN will acquire Itamarati under a deal worth 150 million reais. BBA, in turn, will purchase BCN after Itamarati's acquisition.
-- CONSTRUCTION FIRMS GAVE MORE MONEY TO ELECTIONS IN SAO PAULO
The biggest donations to this year's electoral campaign in Sao Paulo came from construction firms.
Gremio soccer team won the Brazilian championship after beating Portuguesa 2-0 on Sunday.

PMDB senator Carlos Bezerra, who is in charge of the federal budget committee, will maintain in the budget proposal only government funds to health, education, agrarian reform and agricultural projects.
-- Reuters has not verified the stories and cannot vouch for their accuracy.
-- Fatima Cristina, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 507 4151
